Sentencas: This work investigates the behaviour of planar solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) fed by two different fuel mixtures that simulate biogases coming from anaerobic digestion.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The fuel mixtures are namely bio-methane and bio-hydrogen.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The first composition is the conventional one, where a biological process of fermentation is carried out to produce a gas that contains a mixture of methane and carbon dioxide with traces of H(2)S and other organic sulphur compounds.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The second mixture is representative of a biogas produced through a novel routine: a particular pre-treatment of the bacteria inoculum (generally clostridia bacteria) is performed in order to inhibit the methanogenic step in the fermentation process, such that bio-hydrogen is produced as the only effluent of the digester (a mixture of H(2)/CO(2), with no traces of methane).
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Both bio-methane and bio-hydrogen have been directly fed to SOFC planar cells; in particular, an anode supported cell (ASC) with nickel and 8 mol% yttrium-stabilised zirconia (Ni-YSZ), and an electrolyte supported cell (ESC) with a 3YSZ (3 mol% yttrium-stabilised zirconia) electrolyte and a thin Ni-GDC (Ni/Gd-doped ceria) anode have been tested.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The bio-methane resulted in carbon deposition in both cells without the addition of any oxidant to promote methane conversion in H(2) and CO.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The addition of addition of air, steam and CO(2) as oxidants was successfully tested to produce a direct internal reforming of methane onto the anode surface.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For each selected bio-CH(4)/oxidant mixture, a stable behaviour of the cell voltage under load conditions of 0.5 A cm(-2) for the ASC and 0.3 A cm(-2) for the ESC were observed for at least 50 h at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The oxidant addition was demonstrated to be effective in preventing carbon-deposition and converting the methane into H(2) and CO.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The bio-hydrogen was tested and found not to need an oxidant.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Degradation did not occur in a temperature range of 700-850 degrees C.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This biogas was completely safe in terms of carbon-deposition at SOFC temperatures.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An energy model of a complete SOFC system running on reformed bio-methane and on bio-hydrogen in its original composition has been developed.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The results reveal that the best performances are obtained with the steam-reformed methane, where a DC electrical efficiency of over 41% is achieved.
Titulo: Experimental investigation of direct internal reforming of biogas in solid oxide fuel cells
